subject: Re: [junit] assertThat problem

messageBody:
The eq() matcher handles null as a special case.

I would suggest that since you are testing the behaviour of the equals
method itself, you want to make that explicit in the test, and make an
assertion on the result of equals.

E.g. assertThat("is not equal to null", o.equals(null), equalTo(false));

In practice, I'd probably just use assertTrue in that case:

assertTrue("is not equal to null", !o.equals(null));

--Nat
